text: We usually have the lower level being stochastic and the upper level being epistemic, but they could be both epistemic. I guess in a fully bayesian version would be like this

text: So this is a fully bayesian solution to the problem?

elements.text: So this is a fully bayesian solution to the problem?

text: btw I'm saving your comments on all this stuff. Really appreciate the insights, goes deeper than the usual discourse on probabilities

text: I think so, but you need to go to this 2nd level. I think the extreme bayesians would only stick to one level though. Maybe we should run some simulations and see. The failure probability would be a distribution as apposed to an interval for a p-box, or a value for a single distribution.

elements.text: I think so, but you need to go to this 2nd level. I think the extreme bayesians would only stick to one level though. Maybe we should run some simulations and see. The failure probability would be a distribution as apposed to an interval for a p-box, or a value for a single distribution.
